document.docAuthor: MUGRABI, DANIELE F. & AZEVEDO, CELSO O.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Thai Dissomphalus Ashmead, 1893 (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of twenty four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Thai Dissomphalus Ashmead, 1893 (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of twenty four new species

bibRefCitation.author: Terayama
bibRefCitation.refString: Terayama, M. (2001) Descriptions of seven new species of the genus Dissomphalus Ashmead (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from the Oriental Region. Japanese Journal of Systematic Entomology, 7 (1), 81 - 90.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dissomphalus wusheanus Terayama 2001: 87
( ♂ , description, figs 20-21); 2003: 13 (cladistic analysis).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. MALE. Mandible with three apical teeth. Clypeus with trapezoidal median lobe, median carina slightly almost straight and low in profile. Frons somewhat strongly coriaceous, frontal impression short, punctures shallow, dense and large. Vertex broad, slightly convex. Tergal process with pair of elliptical, very shallow lateral depression, latero-anterior border setosesetose, tubercle absent, tuft of few sparse short setae. Base of paramere wider than basiparamere apex; basiparamere narrow in dorsal view and wide in ventral view; aedeagal dorsal body compact, apex of inner lobe widely exposed, wider medially, lateral margin of aedeagal dorsal body slightly sinuous; ventral ramus narrower apically.

Description of metasoma .
Metasomal tergite I with narrow and short groove. Metasomal tergite II with anterolateral margin not setosesetose; tergal process with pair of sub-lateral, transversely elliptical, shallow depressions, divergent posterad, outer lateral margin with short seta directed posterad ( Figs 1 , 22–23 ). Hypopygium with wide median stalk, apex truncate, 0.84 × as long as hypopygium, posterior margin almost straight ( Fig. 102 ). Genitalia ( Figs 151–154 ). Paramere with apex slightly curved medially, basal halves of dorsal and ventral margins parallel in lateral view, apical half inclined and straight in lateral view. Basivolsella with inner margin widened. Cuspis unusually wide. Digitus with expanded base. Aedeagus with ventral ramus much shorter than dorsal body, laminar, surface horizontal, dorsal surface concave, almost entirely wide, apex rounded; dorsal body with one pair of laminar outer apical lobes, surface vertical, apical half curved upward, apex medially scavated. Apodeme of aedeagus extending beyond genital ring.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variations. Setae of metasomal tergite II short or long, thick or thin, placed lateromedially; depressions of tergal process fully rounded or rounded with truncate apical margin or sub-circular, shallow to deep, touching posterior margin of tergite I, touching or not touching posterior margin of tergite II with tufts of depression with elongate to circular; seta length very short to long; outer lateral margin of depression with long and thin seta; inner lateral surface of depression with small or wide tubercle, inclined laterad, with small and narrow pit.

Remarks.
Dissomphalus wusheanus
was the most abundant species in the collected material, representing 42% of the specimens.
D. wusheanus
was previously known only in Taiwan , where only three specimens had been recorded ( Terayama 2001 ). As a result of the present study, it has also been identified in Thailand , which might point to a potentially wider scope of distribution encompassing the neighboring countries. Upon visiting South China Agricultural University, the second author found hundreds of specimens of this species collected from Hainan , China , which strengthens the hypothesis postulating a wider area of distribution.
Dissomphalus wusheanus
is similar to
D. ferrurus
sp. nov.
because of the following characteristics: compact appearance of aedeagal dorsal body with inner lobe widely exposed, wider medially; and basiparamere narrow in dorsal view and wide in ventral view. However, in
D. wusheanus ,
the base of paramere is wider than basiparamere apex; the basivolsella has no projection; the lateral margin of aedeagal dorsal body is slightly sinuous; and the ventral ramus is narrow apically.
Distribution. Thailand ( Chiang Mai , Lampang , Sakon Nakhon , Phitsanulok , Phetchabun , Sakon Nakhon ,
